articles.author: Dan Goodin
articles.title: Gemini hackers can deliver more potent attacks with a helping hand from… Gemini - Ars Technica
articles.description: Hacking LLMs has always been more art than science. A new attack on Gemini could change that.

articles.title: Cooper Flagg sends Duke into Elite Eight while Texas Tech wins an overtime thriller - NPR
articles.description: The Sweet 16 weekend began Thursday night with dramatic late-night games as both men and women roll into action on Friday.
articles.content:
For the Elite Eight in the NCAA men's basketball tournament, the ACC has a Flagg bearer.
As the lone ACC team left in the tournament, Duke with its sensational freshman, Cooper Flagg, held on down t… [+2890 chars]

articles.title: Webb Telescope Captures Neptune’s Long-Hidden Auroras in Stunning Detail - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Long-Sought Auroral Glow Finally Emerges Under Webb’s Powerful Gaze Neptune lies in the cold, dark reaches of the outer edges of our solar system, about 3 billion miles from the Sun, at the farthest edge of the planetary lineup. Only one spacecraft has ever f…
articles.content: Neptune’s elusive auroras have finally been captured in stunning detail by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope. Using its powerful infrared capabilities, scientists detected glowing auroral activity un… [+9240 chars]

articles.title: March Madness highlights: Duke holds off Arizona; Texas Tech storms back to oust Arkansas in OT - The Washington Post
articles.description: Half of the men’s Elite Eight is set after top seeds Duke and Florida took down Arizona and Maryland, respectively, while Texas Tech ousted Arkansas in OT and Alabama rolled over BYU.
